intro: Anthriscus sylvestris var. aemula, commonly known as the slender cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the carrot family (Apiaceae) and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It is often mistaken for other members of its genus due to its similar appearance. Anthriscus sylvestris var. aemula is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
